meanings.sent1: The con artist bilked unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent2: He bilked his friend by promising to return the borrowed money but never did.
meanings.sent3: The tricky magician bilked the audience into believing he could make things disappear.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest salesman bilked customers with false promises of easy wealth.
meanings.sent5: She felt betrayed when she realized she had been bilked by the smooth-talking scammer.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant owner bilked the suppliers by avoiding paying for the delivered goods.
meanings.sent2: He tried to bilk his landlord by sneaking out without settling the rent.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to bilk the vet by escaping before the bill was due.
meanings.sent4: The crafty debtor always found ways to bilk his creditors and delay payments.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox cleverly bilked the farmer by stealing eggs without getting caught.

meanings.sent1: The fake investment scheme bilked many people out of their savings.
meanings.sent2: She felt ashamed after realizing she had been bilked by the smooth-talking salesman.
meanings.sent3: The cunning thief managed to bilk the security guard and escape with the stolen goods.
meanings.sent4: The clever pickpocket bilked unsuspecting tourists in the crowded market.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest contractor bilked the homeowners by overcharging for poor quality work.
